page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY PAISLEY/GLW.
page.content: On this page is explained the origins of place names in Paisley and Glasgow and what these areas are like now. {HAWKHEAD}the origin of this name is not clear. Hawk used to be written "Halk" which is an Anglo-Saxon word meaning "corner"or "recess".Head means the end. The problem is where is the corner or recess? Hawkhead is now an area of private housing,a busy road, and some Industry.It used to be the residence of the Barons of Ross. { {NITSHILL }was originally named "Nuttishill" as there was once a hazelnut grove there.It is now a large busy council housing estate on the outskirts of Glasgow with a number of shops and a railway station. {CHAPELHILL}derives its name from the church that once stood in Blackhall.It is now an area of council housing with a large park.
